From: Daniela Waranie <typo3-community@...>
Subject: Re: JUnit Test Result Format" (XML): No evolution for years?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=466140462
X-Yahoo-Newman-Property: groups-system
X-eGroups-Approved-By: spchappell <simonpeterchappell@...> via web; 17 Sep 2010 23:01:59 -0000

Hi Mike,

thanks for your post.

> My questions are these, is JUnit responsible for this specification?

It seams that the 'specification', that was introduced by the ant team,
is not maintained anymore by the ant team. It seams that the
'specification' was a one time ejection of the ant team. I think (but
iÂ´m not sure) that no one is responsable at the moment. I agree to David
Saff that the JUnit team is not responsable for the 'specification'.

I strongly want to move the 'unit test result format' to the next level.
I think my next step should be to contact the ant team as they are the
legal 'copyright owner' (in the open source meaning) of the
XMLJUnitResultFormatter code. The XMLJUnitResultFormatter code (and
related documents) are the only 'official source' of the
'specification'. I will ask them if the support my idea and how to continue.

Any suggestions who to contact and how to contact ?

> Or is this a request for some JUnit mailing list follower's input
> into the process?
Year, would be great if i get impulse from the community to keep on
going. But at least your thoughts about it and your ideas can help me a
lot. It will be wonderful if i get some combatants.

Best regards
Daniela Waranie
subject: Re: JUnit Test Result Format" (XML): No evolution for years?
